website_summaries.verdict: Large 10-inch subwoofer that uses a heavy, durable casing to keep the internal parts protected.
pros: Easy installation using the included pigtail hookup and mounting hardware
Sound quality is good in marine environments, especially in rough seas or ocean settings
cons: The subwoofer requires a deep hole to mount properly

customer_reviews.title: This really is a great little product
customer_reviews.text: I'm somewhere inbetween. This really is a great little product, to be completely honest. Unfortunately a single one of these leaves a bit to be desired(In all fairness, I am a basshead, though). When the gains are adjusted appropriately, it has a nice little output. Jack them up and she gets loud as can be, but sounds sloppy. I would recommend it if you're not expecting to rattle everyone in the marina. If you want to, buy multiples. Great sounding units with moderate output. Also very convenient with the built in amplifier.
customer_reviews.author: Grubbs

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money and no warranty
customer_reviews.text: Worked for about 2 months. Had it professionally installed and it isn't worth the price for the sound and definitely not worth it for how long it lasted. No warranty through Amazon either. Huge waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Louis Kolbauer

customer_reviews.title: DOA from the get go, Vendor did their part to make right...
customer_reviews.text: I cannot complain about the sales experience but was very unhappy that it took so long to get to find out it was DOA, they tested another in their shop also DOA. They ended up sending me a completely different model which is working fine.
customer_reviews.author: IssaquahWA1979

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Do not last long bought 2 both only lasted 1 season
customer_reviews.author: John C.

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product
customer_reviews.text: Installed Sub ơn my boat and only lasted maybe 3 month Trying to return for refund or a replacing ít. So i bought 12in Rockfordfosgate Sub and 500 watt Rockfordfosgate Amp and installed. ít rocks hard and powerfull. Dont buy Jbl sub
customer_reviews.author: HERSILIA M.

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: this is a great unit for the price. i just installed one my 21' boat and only have to turn the radio up half way compared to almost max before to great all around sound from the entire system. exactly what i was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: jay jawort

customer_reviews.title: no warranty!!
customer_reviews.text: complete junk...don't by from here no warranty.. JBL just denied my warranty due to they are not a authorized dealer..I'm very unhappy.
customer_reviews.author: Harrison Griffith

customer_reviews.title: Installed in my Seadoo Islandia
customer_reviews.text: Added this sub to my existing setup. What a difference it makes. I've set my 6 1/2 speakers to mid and high frequency and let this sub bring the low.
customer_reviews.author: Duane Dyer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, looks nice but not impressed with the sound quality. Bass is flat and after hrs of adjusting it the sound is less than steller. Just think twice before you cut a 12" hole to mount this thing in your boat.
customer_reviews.author: Little bit of everything

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound had to replace under warranty less than a year old?????
customer_reviews.text: When it works, it sounds awesome!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! The coil went bad and it took over a month for JBL to cover under warranty. I had to remove the old one and bring it to one of their authorized shops. They shipped me a new one. Would like to know why it went bad, only had around ten hours on it. If its Marine grade I would expect it to last longer. The new one will be covered, hope this helps as the system sounds awesome!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: GJC

customer_reviews.title: jbl MPS1000 subwoofer
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this product. Excellent bass response. The instructions were good and It was an easy install
customer_reviews.author: jim r reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Subwoofer
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Boat and in process of installing it. Can't wait to hear the sound in my boat. I did listen to this a a local car toys store and it's impressive. Also nice that it has it's own amp built in.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations!!!
customer_reviews.text: Loved the idea of the built in amp. Installed in my 25' mid- cabin with open bow under rear bench seat. Template was spot on, wiring in simple especially with extra sub RCA outputs. The sound is exactly what I was looking for. The extra thump but not obnoxious sounding. Lots of tuning options on sub and look great.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Light rain seeped into the electronics and destroyed the sub.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Zdon

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy if you are not installing it right away or within 30 days
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in October for my boat installed it on may 31 and the speaker is blown. Looks brand new cut the hole out of my fiberglass spect a few hours fishing wires only to have it sound like poo,!! Seller return policy is 30 days. I hope they will make an exception in this case considering we are in ne Ohio and I just am getting around to my boat ..I will update the review after giving the seller a chance to make it right.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Pritchard

customer_reviews.title: Not Marine Grade
customer_reviews.text: Very bad experience with this subwoofer. I have tried twice, it is not waterproof it does not even have a marine rating does not withstand marine use. First one lasted 2 months an the second only 3 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: marco luna

customer_reviews.title: $180 wasted.
customer_reviews.text: Bought used and no returns. Worked for a few days and now it's fried. I don't get it and not sure what to do with no returns allowed. $180 wasted.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: not bad
customer_reviews.text: seems like it might not have 250 watts. when with my system if you crank it up the speaker vibrates and you have to turn down the sub power to get a clear sound again. the switch on the speaker for the power level i can only turn it up half way or speaker vibrates. maybe thats why it seems to not have the watts because i can't turn it up all the way.other than that it sounds great and thumps good. wish i could turn it up more though.
customer_reviews.author: boater

customer_reviews.title: Bass Heads Look Elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking to rattle your hatches this sub will not do that, what it will do is add good clean bass to create a balanced system. Easy to install and adjust. Everything about this product from the packaging to casing speaks to the quality of this item.
customer_reviews.author: Just James not Jessie

customer_reviews.title: I thought it would give more bass than what it ...
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would give more bass than what it does. It is in a 22 ft pontoon boat so maybe the area is too large.
customer_reviews.author: AMZ Customer Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Awesome subwoofer for my boat!
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME Subwoofer that I installed in my boat, really easy to install, setup and configure. be sure that you have enough depth in your boat or whatever...but is will really sound great and it is waterproof too!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen L. Sanders

customer_reviews.title: JBL rules
customer_reviews.text: Nothing else compares! When everything else fails as usual,,the amp (3rd one),,,the reciever,,(2nd one) this darn subwoofer shines! It still uses a lot of power but you can dial it down when not wanting to jam to save battery. The only design improvement i would make would be to include some type of switch/push button on/off switch to turn it off when just wanting to listen to a ball game w/ treble from the other speakers and not wanting to jam out some wide spread panic, etc..! Overall fantastic purchase for me which seems to be rare these days.
customer_reviews.author: div3

customer_reviews.title: Buy this subwoofer!!
customer_reviews.text: High high quality subwoofer for our boat, loud and thumpy bass. 250 RMS just sounds very under-rated for this subwoofer, it seems much louder than that! Overall great!!
customer_reviews.author: Colin F.

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not big bass but it did and some nice low end to the boat.
customer_reviews.author: steve harper

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good sub it added the missing sound to my boats stereo.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I expected more output but should have known better with an all-in-one option
customer_reviews.author: G. L. Ealey

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, but too big for my boat
customer_reviews.text: One should pay attention to the actual dimensions of this great performing subwoofer, before buying, specially if you have space restrictions. Although this is a 10" Sub, the external (finishing) ring has a square bit protruding at the bottom (easily seen in the picture, where the red JBL logo is), that will add an extra inch to the whole thing. This totally ruined it for me, as I had very limited clearance, where the sub was supposed to go. Passed it on to a friend, who installed it on his boat and is loving it.
customer_reviews.author: By the Seller

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: bass output is weak should be much better for the brand that it is
customer_reviews.author: ajgz

customer_reviews.title: piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: worked for all of a week now broken... don't have time to uninstall and send back so heres heads up for anyone that wants one of these... save your hard earned money
customer_reviews.author: Panhandle Diesel

customer_reviews.title: No manual to how intall inside box
customer_reviews.text: I find some dificult to install this active subwoofer , becasuse in box dont has any manual , and dont give any explication how connect every wire in JBL Marine amplifier, i try to searn on line and nothing find. now i should guess , how connect it
customer_reviews.author: Cajacontrol

customer_reviews.title: good quality woofer
customer_reviews.text: liked it for the money,and it sounds great, other brand 300 more and not worth it
customer_reviews.author: jose luis calixtro

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: It sound really good and it was a great addition to my stereo system, it worked for 1 season, this season I was doing deep cleaning of the interior of my bridge and decided to rinse the soap from the grille of the subwoofer and that was it! It started making strange sounds and noises, and day later stopped working at all! Its garbage for the money! Not waterproof at all!
customer_reviews.author: Vito S.

customer_reviews.title: Don't Break the Grill!
customer_reviews.text: Sub sounds decent and being an all-in-one unit makes it easier to install, but if the grill breaks on it (which it will eventually because it's made of plastic and will disintegrate after some time in the sun/weather like mind did) there is no replacement grill available and it is built into the entire unit, so you can't even put an aftermarket one on it. So you're left with either a crappy looking sub or forced to buy an entire new unit just for the cheapy plastic grill on the front. This fact alone, I'd reconsider this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Template was great and it installed easily
customer_reviews.text: I just installed one of these in a club car precedent golf cart. Template was great and it installed easily. I really liked the weight and the materials. It shows off nicely. However, when connected to stereo with RCA cables (preferred) the speaker would rumble badly with any kind of volume. At low volume levels it sounds decent. It gets to rattling pretty bad when you turn it up. I've adjusted the controls by turning them all the way down to help avoid rattling, but it's still annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Ellefson

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Lasted only a week. The second time that I used it stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: Sideray

customer_reviews.title: Great sound....great product!
customer_reviews.text: JBL makes really great stuff. The prices are also great. Love the full rich sound! Recomend this product for any boat audio enthusiast!
customer_reviews.author: Timmy

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, easy install
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these for my 19' bowrider. I didn't want to or have to room to build a box so I got these. I am 100% satisfied with the result. Adjusted properly these subs are loud and clean! They put off very little heat and are light weight (due to the class D amp) which is always important in a boat. I have 260w rms driving my mid base speakers and these subs almost overpower them. If you are looking for great marine subs that have an easy setup for a great price these are the ones you want.
customer_reviews.author: Reid Thompson

product_meta.title: JBL MPS1000 10-Inch 250-Watt Powered Marine Subwoofer
product_meta.description:
Product Packaging:Standard PackagingJBL 10" 250-Watt Powered Marine Subwoofer

AMAZON.COM
Upgrade the sound on your boat with the MPS1000 10-inch, 250-Watt Powered Marine Subwoofer from JBL®. The MPS1000 offers the big, heart-thumping bass you need to break through the engine noise, waves, and gusty wind you will encounter on the water. Built to withstand harsh salt air and corrosion, the MPS1000 features a marinized circuit board with controls located on the front panel under a watertight, protective cover, as well as a polypropylene cone and stainless steel hardware--to withstand anything. With 12dB electronic crossovers, the MPS1000 offers tuning options for systems of all sizes while the variable bass-boost optimizes the performance even when you have limited placement options. Finally, thanks to its compact size and low heat sink, it is easy to install the MPS1000 in tight spaces.

 

Engineered for harsh marine conditions: * Controls located on the front panel under watertight, protective cover 
 * Marinized circuit board 
 * Polypropylene cone 
 * Stainless steel hardware 
 * Waterproofing

Tuning options for systems of any size: * Onboard 12dB electronic crossovers ensuring tuning options for systems of any size

Optimized performance in any location: * Variable bass-boost circuit provides additional bass tuning 
 * Built-in bass EQ provides 40Hz adjustment between -6dB and +3dB 

Easy installation in tight spaces: * Measures 9 by 10-1/4 by 2-3/16 inches 
 * Subwoofer dimensions: 13-1/16 by 7-15/16 by 13 inches 
 * Low profile heat sink 
 * Integrated amplifier and enclosure 
 * Mounts like a car subwoofer 

Big, dynamic power: * Output of 60 watts RMS 
 * Peak power handling of 160 watts 

 Audio Specifications:

 * Signal-to-Noise Ratio: 81.1dB 
 * Maximum Current Draw: 14A 
 * Input Sensitivity: * Line-Level Input: 100mV to 6V
    * Speaker-Level Input: 1V to 13V
   
   

What's in the Box?
MPS 1000 10-Inch 250-Watt Powered Marine Subwoofer, mounting template, owner's manual
feature_bullets: 10-inch, 250-watt powered marine subwoofer engineered for harsh marine conditions
Integrated amplifier and enclosure; mounts like a car subwoofer
Built-in 12dB electronic crossover allows adjustment between 70Hz and 170Hz
Built-in bass EQ provides 40Hz adjustment between -6dB and +3dB
Controls are located on the front panel under a watertight protective cover; one year warranty

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.4 out of 5 stars56 ratings3.4 out of 5 stars
